N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1500.5 - Appeals

State Regulations

Any part whose request for a record or records of the CDTA
and its subsidiaries is denied may appeal such denial in writing, to the
chairman of the Capital District Transportation Authority or the chairman of
the Capital District Transit System, Capital District Transportation District

Incorporated or the chairman of the Capital District Transit System, Number

One, Capital District Transportation District Incorporated or the chairman of
the Capital District Transit System, Number Two, Capital District

Transportation District Incorporated. The party so applying shall be informed
of the chairman's decision, in writing, within 10 business days of the receipt
of such an appeal, and if the request is denied, shall fully explain the
reasons therefor. A denial by the chairman shall be subject to review in the
manner provided in article 78 of the Civil Practice Law and
